metadata.synopsis:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.

3.speaker: Lia
3.text: Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.
3.context: NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

45.speaker: Rolan
45.text: I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.
45.context: NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

10.speaker: Cal
10.text: Can we all just take a moment? Please?
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation. NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

47.speaker: Lia
47.text: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.
47.context: NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

21.speaker: Lia
21.text: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

43.speaker: Cal
43.text: Or yell louder. That's fine too.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him. NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

41.speaker: Player
41.context: NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle. You don't wish to fight with your sister and you definitely don't want to see her hurt but staying.

5.speaker: Cal
5.text: Rolan's right, sis. We should leave - while we still can.
5.context: NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle. You don't wish to fight with your sister and you definitely don't want to see her hurt but staying.

56.speaker: Lia
56.text: Argh. Fine. Let's sneak away like godsdamned cowards.
56.context: NodeContext:  You know you've lost the argument and this is a last little dig at the end. It's your temper getting the better of you. You're not yelling, but it's said with quiet fury.

40.speaker: Lia
40.text: But if something happens to these people, it's on us. I hope you know that.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning away in a huff. Arms crossed, Angry. NodeContext: Ibid.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Get out while you can - the goblins will be back.
39.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed with you. Said almost as you throw you hands in the air. You think it's ludicrous that anyone WOULDN'T agree with you.

20.speaker: Rolan
20.text: Common sense at last. Let's get out of this death trap.
20.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed with you. Said almost as you throw you hands in the air. You think it's ludicrous that anyone WOULDN'T agree with you.

30.speaker: Cal
30.text: C'mon, sis. We're less of a target alone. We should leave.
30.context: NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle. You don't wish to fight with your sister and you definitely don't want to see her hurt but staying.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards player at thank you but is looking at Rolan. NodeContext: The player has agreed with you. Thank you is directed at player, the rest at Rolan. You know the argument has likely been won by you - trying to appeal to his morality.

46.speaker: Rolan
46.text: Thank you! It's the right thing to do, and you know it.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards player at thank you but is looking at Rolan. NodeContext: The player has agreed with you. Thank you is directed at player, the rest at Rolan. You know the argument has likely been won by you - trying to appeal to his morality.

28.speaker: Lia
28.text: Thank you! It's the right thing to do, and you know it.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards player at thank you but is looking at Rolan. NodeContext: The player has agreed with you. Thank you is directed at player, the rest at Rolan. You know the argument has likely been won by you - trying to appeal to his morality.

53.speaker: Cal
53.text: She's right, Rolan. We're better than this.
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Almost nudging Rolan with a smile on his face.NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle.

34.speaker: Rolan
34.text: Zurgan. Fine. I'll stay too. Lest you both end up with your throats slit by a goblin blade.
34.context: NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' You know you've lost and you are NOT being gracious. Rolling your eyes - you love them both but are playing up you staying - like you're doing them a favour.

7.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
7.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

11.speaker: Rolan
11.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
11.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

4.speaker: Rolan
4.text: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal. NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.
55.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

15.speaker: Lia
15.text: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?
15.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

12.speaker: Rolan
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

8.speaker: Rolan
8.text: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...
8.context: NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

14.speaker: Lia
14.text: Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.
14.context: NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

48.speaker: Rolan
48.text: But it is, nevertheless, true. We've risked everything to get this far, we can't afford to throw it all away.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Clan is everything. You don't abandon those you swore to protect.

27.speaker: Rolan
27.text: I made no such oath, and I will not be held responsible for these people.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: If they cannot fight, they will die. That is as it should be.

25.speaker: Rolan
25.text: Exactly! These types always need saving. We shouldn't sacrifice ourselves for them.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Have you forgotten Elturel? We should stand by our people - no one else will.

42.speaker: Rolan
42.text: This isn't Elturel and I'm not responsible for every damn tiefling in the world!

17.speaker: Lia
17.text: Just be responsible for yourself then. We have to stay; it's the right thing to do.

37.speaker: Rolan
37.text: Zurgan. Fine! We'll stay. If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...

16.speaker: Lia
16.context: NodeContext: Said sincerely - you've seen Rolan fight and you want him at your side.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Only cowards run from a fight.

44.speaker: Lia
44.text: Prove them wrong, then. If you think you're able to, that is.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I'd choose the wilderness over the dangers of a city any day. Stay.

22.speaker: Rolan
22.text: What? The dangers of overpriced taverns and muddy streets? I think I'll take that risk.

33.speaker: Lia
33.text: The city's not going anywhere. I'm staying - we're needed here.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Why die for those who can't defend themselves?

32.speaker: Rolan
32.text: Exactly! Hear that, Lia? We're not helping anyone if we're corpses.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: To leave is a heavy choice - it will weigh on whatever path you walk next.

31.speaker: Lia
31.text: Just like I was saying. I don't want all these lives on my conscience. We need to stay.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: 'Where the weak have need, the strong have a duty'. Stay.
